newsitem.title: AFGHANISTAN: Kabul envoy seeks French aid workers' release.
newsitem.headline: Kabul envoy seeks French aid workers' release.

text.p: A French diplomat said on Saturday he would visit officials of the militant Taleban movement on Sunday to discuss the plight of two imprisoned French aid workers.
"Tomorrow I have an appointment with the (Taleban) Attorney-General, and I am continuing to carry on my contacts with the other authorities," French Charge d'Affaires Didier Leroy told Reuters.
He said he had been given free access to the detained men and that he was satisfied that they were being well treated.
"We have been able to see the prisoners every day. The prison guards and the director of the prison are taking good care of them," he said.
Frenchmen Frederic Michel and Jose Daniel Llorente, who work for the Paris-based charity Action Contre la Faim (Action Against Hunger), were arrested a week ago.
The are being investigated for "immoral acts" which were allegedly committed during a lunch given by the charity's female expatriate staff for their female Afghan colleagues.
The Taleban, a militant Islamic and mainly Pushtun-speaking militia, has overrun much of southern Afghanistan in its attempt to impose a strict fundamentalist order.
